job_title: Homecare & Hospice Scheduler  in Frankenmuth, MI
pros: If you are looking for a team and company that actually cares about you as a person as well as the job you are doing this is the place to work.
cons: You need to be passionate about what you are doing and about the mission of Wellspring.

review_title: One of the best companies out there to work for
pros: Company is being very flexible with pay based on experience in your field of work. They understand the competition and are doing a great job of meeting expectations.
cons: Pay still isn't quite up to what other businesses are paying.

job_title: Family Preservation Worker in Traverse City, MI
pros: Mileage for travel and lap top provided
cons: There are no guaranteed hours, not even during training. I received approx. 5 hours a week

job_title: Financial Reporting Director in Flint, MI
pros: Great group of people to work with
cons: Lack of diversity in employees

review_title: RN wages not competitive with area
pros: Good staff 8 hour shifts Clean facility
cons: Low pay rates compared to other facilities in area Insurance is not the best

review_title: Do not bother unless you need experience.
pros: Flexibility in schedule and can work from home.
cons: Too much traveling insurance was horrible and pay was not enough.

review_title: Ok if you're starting out in the field, not sustainable..
pros: Rewarding work, diverse clients, mileage reimbursement, time freedom
cons: Pay did not match amount of work expected; management did not care to pay us more when caseworkers asked; all money is at the top of the hierarchy; company did not reimburse for interior vehicle wear caused by clients; had to transport clients frequently. As always, numbers seemed more important than effectively servicing families.

review_title: Love the environment but the salary and benefits are really nonsensical.
job_title: Program Secretary in Oak Park, MI
pros: I work with some of the most awesome people and they've taught me so much. My boss is amazing and she never misses a beat. The work life balance is really nice.
cons: The benefits are too expensive. When people quit, they expect others to do their job with no additional compensation. There's no tuition reimbursement. Upper management is scary. The salary is scary low even for a private non-profit.

pros: Management was easy to approach and very helpful
cons: Burnout, low pay, high/difficult caseloads at times.

job_title: Substance Use Disorder Clinician in Clare, MI
pros: Flexible schedule, Work from home, mileage reimbursement
cons: Getting paid salary and working more than 40 hours

job_title: FTBS Worker in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: good employees, good staff, supportive
cons: terrible pay, fast turnover, stress

pros: friendly staff and friendly residents
cons: benefits too expensive better if you have spouse you get your benefits from and decline theirs.

pros:
I work at the Monroe nursing home. I've been here five years full time, but recently got another job and am now part time here. All coworkers and immediate supervisors are great to work with.
An OK place to work if you don't have a better option.
cons:
Corporate is clueless as to what we need on a daily basis. Never adequately staffed. Corporate only hires incompetent administrators, because they're only looking for a pawn with an NHA license. Never any postive feedback from corporate, and no incentive to go above and beyond. When I was hired at my new job, my supervisor at wellspring asked hr for a slight raise to keep me there. HR's response was, "We don't do that here." I'm a good employee with a good record who is capable of performing tasks which no one else in my department is able, and I hold licenses pertaining to equipment in the facility which no one else holds, but wellspring is ready to lose me over $1.30 an hour. The healthcare coverage here is a joke. It's fairly resonable to cover my own costs, but when my daughter was born she had to be on medicaid because to cover her would have been over 700 a month and I make less than 30000 yearly.
I could go on and on.

job_title: Foster Care Case Aide in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Good work culture, supportive staff
cons: stress, pay, clients, driving long days

pros: Every other weekend off, and they actually CARE about patients. Decent pay- Not the best for home health, but it gets the bills paid. The supervisors are so nice, and they actually understand if you have any issues with any of the clients.
cons: Takes a while to get raises, and as I stated before, the pay isn't GREAT to start off with. The supervisors are great, but they are hard to get a hold of. Wish they would actually answer their phones more.

job_title: Case Aide in East Lansing, MI
pros: I have worked at the East Lansing location for six months now. Incredibly supportive work environment. Flexible. Supervisors are highly approachable. Caseworkers are considerate and respectful of aides, foster parents, birth parents, and kids.
cons: No full-time options for case aides, but you do get a ton in mileage. No benefits for part-time employees. A lot of turnover because of pay. The nature of the job makes hours inconsistent, but supervisors work to make sure you get your 20-25 hours.

review_title: Exciting and challenging work with children and families
pros: Wellspring is truly committed to its vision of changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities. Wellspring has afforded me many opportunities to work with vulnerable families and individuals in the state of Michigan and is a leader in shaping the services of senior care and child welfare.
cons: The work can be stressful and, although its rewarding, it is very difficult when the people we serve struggle. Also the job can be very difficult if you aren't prepared to be flexible with the ever-changing human services field.

pros: Wellspring have employees working for them that care about the clients and residents. When there have been company-wide changes, the CEO is very upfront about the changes and how it will affect you. My co-workers are helpful and willing to go the extra mile. The environment in the office is business like and quiet, but we also have fun playing games and potlucks on occasion!
cons: The health benefits are not that great if you decide or have to use the family coverage. They have asked for feedback from employees on the benefits and have made some improvements.

pros:
- The most caring, positive group of people I've ever worked with.
- Great work life balance, flexible scheduling for employees with families.
- Fair pay, good health care options.
- Advancement opportunities.
- A chance to do work that has meaning.  You're not making or selling something, you're helping children, families, and/or the elderly.
cons: - A career that is meaningful is sometimes stressful.  We help people that are often times in tough positions, and it can take a toll on employees.

job_title: Foster Care Licensing Worker in Gaylord, MI
pros: This is a great place to work! Team culture promotes positivity and support in the job. Regular recognition of job well done by employees and fun team building activities help reduce natural stress from the job. Satisfied and supported workers can deliver excellent customer or client services/experiences.
cons: The application and onboarding process can be tricky (hint: watch your spam folder for the emails from HR) but it is worth it!!

review_title: Combining Faith and Service in a Meaningful Career
pros: I've worked at Wellspring Lutheran Services for more than 20 years, and I love it.  This is an exciting, challenging, ever-changing company that allows me to grow and serve.  It is also a faith-based organization that encourages me to express my faith when serving others.
cons: As a non-profit organization, Wellspring works hard to overcome barriers to funding by federal and state government programs.  And new barriers arise frequently.

pros: It's easier if you just do your job and not gossip not your time it's theirs and they don't have much longer most of the time
cons: The point system for tardiness and how they go about corporate finding out in the fire people they don't see how you work with the residents everyday and your impact it's just either too soon or a few minutes due to shift change

review_title: Good team to work with, terrible company to work for
job_title: Foster Care Licensing Worker in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Teamwork, peer support, a welcoming environment, people are willing to help you, somewhat flexible schedule
cons: Lots of evening work, on-call work that is poorly compensated ($50 a week), occasional weekend work, high stress, terrible health insurance, extremely low pay, company does not listen to concerns raised by staff, bad at employee retention and at showing employee appreciation. It is always expected that you will go "above and beyond" with no extra compensation, leading to burnout. Your job is expected to be your life.

pros: Nothing, this place is very difficult to find any pros.
cons: The pay in incredibly low (below living wage), unfair work conditions, supervisors do not listen to the concerns, morale is extremely low. This place is slowly losing employees, and instead of hiring new people they take the workload and place it on someone else which creates burnout. This place is deplorable.

review_title: A good company to work for.
job_title: Foster Care Case Manager in Bay City, MI
pros: Our entire team works as a team and are very supportive of each other. Company encourages you to volunteer with different organizations.
cons: You work more than 40 hours a week without getting overtime.  Mileage reimbursement is very low compared to other companies.

pros: Helping children and families.  Opportunity to learn the foster care system.  Meeting great kids.
cons: Poor management.  Does not listen to employees.  Pay does not match education and/or experience.  Overworked.

review_title: Overall an okay place to work
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Laid back work environment, relaxed dress code, flexible hours, good staff
cons: Low pay, poor mileage rate, little room to move up with higher education, stressful work, many inconsistencies between supervisors

job_title: Shelter Worker in Farmington Hills, MI
pros: Schedule is convenient, pay is fair, easy job, interpersonal skills developed.
cons: Lack of advancement, limited opportunities to persuade a long term career.

pros: Hours flexibility, good cause to work for.
cons: No work reference from managers.

pros:
Great team environment
flexibility
Good salary for area
Upper management committed to making improvements
cons: Health Care benefits not affordable for a family. Very affordable for an individual.

pros: They were ok for working there
cons: Some people were a little harder to deal with than otheres

pros: Staff is very supportive and residents are wonderful.
cons: Covid has made this a difficult job to have at a nursing home.

pros: Great organization, great mission, really care about their employees
cons: The only con is I wish benefits were slightly lower cost

pros: Great people to work with.
